Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.
<description type="note">Square brackets represent sections of text unclear in the original and supplied by the current editor.</description>

Tunc venit Abysakar episcopus Listenyth lordyngys bothe hye and lowe And tendyrly takyth heyd on to my sawe beth buxom and benyngne ?our busshopp to knowe Ffor I am Ã¾at lord Ã¾at made Ã¾is lawe With hertys so hende herkyn nowe ?oure damyselys to weddyng ?a loke Ã¾at ?e drawe Ã¾at passyn xiiij ?ere for what Ã¾at ?e owe Ã¾e lawe of god byddyth Ã¾is sawe Ã¾at at xiiij ?ere of age Euery damesel what so sche be to Ã¾e Encrese of more plente xulde be browght in good degre On to here spowsage. Joachym Herke now Anne my jentyl spowse how Ã¾at Ã¾e buschop his lawe hath tolde Ã¾at what man hath a dowtyr in his house Ã¾at passyth xiiij ?erys olde He muste here brynge I herde hym Rowse In to Ã¾e tempyl a spowse to wedde wher for oure dowtyr ryth good and dowse In to Ã¾e tempyl sche must be ledde nd Ã¾at anoon ryght sone. Anne Sere I grawnt Ã¾at it be so A-?en Ã¾e lawe may we not do with here to-gedyr lete us now go I hold it ryght weyl done. Joachym Sere busshopp here aftyr Ã¾in owyn hest we haue here brought oure dowtyr dere mary my swete childe she is ful prest of Age she is ful xiiij ?ere. Episcopus Welcome joachym on to myn A-reste bothe anne Ã¾i wyff and mary clere now mary chylde to Ã¾e lawe Ã¾ou leste and chese Ã¾e a spowse to be Ã¾i ffere Ã¾at lawe Ã¾ou must fful-ffylle. Maria A-?ens Ã¾e lawe wyl I nevyr be but mannys ffelachep xal nevyr folwe me I wyl levyn evyr in chastyte be Ã¾e grace of goddys wylle. Episcopus A Ffayre mayde why seyst Ã¾ou so what menyth the for to levyn chast why wylt Ã¾ou not to weddyng go Ã¾e cawse Ã¾ou telle me and Ã¾at in hast. Maria My ffadyr and my modyr sertys also Er I was born ?e may me trast thei were bothe bareyn here frute was do they come to Ã¾e tempyl at Ã¾e last to do here sacryfice By-cause they hadde nothyr frute nere chylde reprevyd Ã¾ei wore of wykkyd and wyllde with grett shame Ã¾ei were revylyd Al men dede them dyspyce. My Ffadyr and my modyr thei wepte full sore fful hevy here hertys wern of Ã¾is dede with wepynge eyn Ã¾ei preyd Ã¾erfore Ã¾at god wolde socowre hem and sende hem sede Iff god wold graunt hem a childe be bore They be-hest Ã¾e chylde here lyff xulde lede In goddys temple to serve evyr-more and wurchep god in loue and drede Than god fful of grace he herd here longe prayour and Ã¾an sent hem both seed and flowre whan I was born in here bowre to Ã¾e temple offryd I was. Whan Ã¾at I was to Ã¾e temple brought and offerde up to god Above ther hestyd I as myn hert thought to serve my god with hertyly love Clennesse and chastyte myn hert owth Erthely creature nevyr may shoue Such clene lyff xuld ?e nouht In no maner wyse reprove to Ã¾is clennesse I me take this is Ã¾e cawse as I ?ow tell Ãat I with man wyll nevyr mell in Ã¾e servyse of god wyl I evyr dwell I wyl nevyr haue other make. Episcopus A mercy god Ã¾ese wordys wyse of Ã¾is fayr mayde clene thei trobyl myn hert in many wyse her wytt is grett and Ã¾at is sene In clennes to levyn in godys servise no man here blame non here tene And ?it in lawe Ã¾us it lyce Ã¾at such weddyd xulde bene who xal expownd Ã¾is oute Ã¾e lawe doth after lyff of clennes Ã¾e lawe doth bydde such maydenes expres Ã¾at to spowsyng they xulde hem dres God help us in Ã¾is dowhte. This Ansuere grettly trobelyth me to mak a vow to creaturys it is lefful Vovete et reddite in scripture haue we and to observe oure lawe also it is nedful In Ã¾is to dyscerne to me it is dredful Ã¾erfore to cowcell me in Ã¾is cas I calle Ã¾e holde and Ã¾e wyse and swiche as ben spedful In Ã¾is sey ?our a-vyse I be-sech ?ow Alle. Minister To breke our lawe and custom it wore hard in dede And on Ã¾at other syde to do a-?en scrypture to ?eve sentens in Ã¾is degre ?e must take goo hede ffor dowteles Ã¾is matere is dyffuse and obscure Myn avyse here in Ã¾is I ?ow ensure Ã¾at we prey all god to haue relacion ffor be prayour grett knowlech men recure and to Ã¾is I counsell ?ow to ?eve assygnacion. Episcopus Trewly ?our counsell is ryght good and eylsum And as ?e han seyd so xal it be I charge ?ow bretheryn and systerys hedyr ?e com and to-gedyr to god now pray we That it may plese his fynyte deyte knowleche in Ã¾is to sendyn vs Et hic cantent veni creator Mekely eche man ffalle down on kne And we xal be-gynne Veni creator Spiritus and whan Veni creator is don Ã¾e buschop xal seyng Now lord god of lordys whysest of alle et cetera. I pray Ã¾e lorde knelynge on kne with carefull herte I crye and calle Ã¾is dowteful dowte enforme Ã¾ou me. Angelus Thy prayour is herd to hy? hevyn halle god hath me sent here down to the to telle Ã¾e what Ã¾at Ã¾ou do xalle and how Ã¾ou xalt be rewlyd in iche degre take tent and vndyrstond This is goddys owyn byddyng Ã¾at all kynsmen of dauyd Ã¾e kyng to Ã¾e temple xul brynge here du offryng with whyte ?ardys in Ã¾er honde. loke wele what tyme Ã¾ei offere there all here ?ardys in Ã¾in hand Ã¾ou take take heed whose ?erde doth blome and bere and he xal be Ã¾e maydenys make. Episcopus I thank Ã¾e lord with mylde chere thi wurde xal I werkyn with-owtyn wrake I xal send for hem bothyn fer and nere to werke Ã¾i wyl I vndyr-take A-non it xal be do herk masangere Ã¾ou wend Ã¾i way Dauyd kynsmen as I Ã¾e say byd hem come offyr Ã¾is same day and brynge white ?ardys Also. Nuncius Oy al maner men takyth to me tent that be owgth of kynrede to dauid Ã¾e kyng my lord Ã¾e busshop hath for ?ow sent to Ã¾e temple Ã¾at ?e come with ?our offryng. Joseph In gret labore my lyff I lede myne ocupasyoun lyth in many place ffor febylnesse of age my jorney I may not spede I thank the gret god of thi grace. 1us generacionis dauid what chere Joseph what ys the case That ye lye here on this ground. Joseph age and febylnesse doth me enbrace That I may nother well goo ne stound. ijus generacion[is] We be commandyd be the beschoppys sond That euery man of Dauyd Kynrede In the tempyll to offyr a wond Therfor in this Jorney let vs procede. Joseph Me to traveyll yt is no nede I prey you frendys go forth your wey. iijus generacion[is] yis com forth Joseph I you rede and knowyth what the buschop woll sey. iiijus gener[acionis] Ther ys a mayd whos name is clepyd mary Doughter to joachy? as it is told here to mary thei woll asay To so? many dowty and bold He chargight Ã¾at ?e hast ?ow for he is redy bent ?ow to receyve at ?our comyng He byddyth ?ow fferthermore in handys Ã¾at ?e hent A fayre white ?erde everych of ?ow ?e bryng In hyght Tary not I pray ?ow My lord as I say ?ow now to receyve ?ow is full redy dyght. Joseph Benedicite I can not vndyr stande What oure prince of prestys doth men Ã¾at every man xuld come and brynge with hym a whande Abyl to be maryed Ã¾at is not I so mote I then I haue be maydon evyr and evyr more wele ben I chaungyd not ?et of all my long lyff and now to be maryed sum man wold wen it is a straunge thynge An old man to take a ?onge wyff. but nevyr-Ã¾e-lesse no doute of we must forth to towne now neyborys and kynnysmen lete us forth go I xal take a wand in my hand and cast of my gowne yf I falle Ã¾an I xalle gronyn for wo Ho so take A-way my staff I say he were my fo ?e be men Ã¾at may wele ren go ?e be-fore I am old and also colde walkyng doth me wo Ã¾erfore now wole I so my staff holde I Ã¾is jurny to wore. Episcopus Serys ?e xal vndyr-stande Ã¾at Ã¾is is Ã¾e cawse of our comynge and why Ã¾at ech of ?ow bryngyth a wande ffor of god we haue knowynge here is to be maryde a mayde ?ynge all ?our roddys ?e xal brynge vp to me and on hese rodde Ã¾at Ã¾e holy gost is syttynge hic portent virgas he xal Ã¾e husbond of Ã¾is may be. Joseph It xal not be I ley a grote I xal a-byde be-hynde preuyly now wolde god I were at hom in my cote I am aschamyd to be seyn veryly. Primus generacionis dauid To wurchep my lord god hedyr am I come here ffor to offyr my dewe offrynge A fayr white ?arde in hand haue I nome my lord sere busshop at ?our byddynge. Secundus generacionis dauid Off dauythis kynred sertys am I com a ffayr white ?arde in hand now I bryng my lord Ã¾e busshop after ?our owyn dom Ã¾is ?arde do I offre at ?our chargyng Ryht here. Tercius generacionis dauid And I a ?arde haue both fayr and whyght here in myn hond it is redy dyght And here I offre it forth within syght Ryght in good manere. Quartus generacionis dauid I am Ã¾e fourte of Dauid is kyn and with myn offrynge my god I honoure Ã¾is fayr whyte ?arde is offryng myn I trost in god of sum socoure Com on Joseph with offrynge Ã¾in and brynge up Ã¾in as we han oure Ã¾ou taryst ryth longe be-hynde certeyn why comyst not fforth to goddys toure Com on man for shame. Joseph Com ?a ?a god help full fayn I wolde but I am so Agyd and so olde Ã¾at both myn leggys gyn to folde I am ny Almost lame. Episcopus A mercy lord I kan no sygne a-spy It is best we go a-geyn to prayr. Vox he brought not up his rodde ?et trewly to whom Ã¾e mayd howyth to be maryed her. Episcopus Whath joseph why stande ?e there by-hynde I-wys sere ?e be to blame. Joseph Sere I kan not my rodde ffynde to come Ã¾er in trowth me thynkyht shame. Episcopus Comyth thens Joseph Sere he may Euyl go Ã¾at is ner lame in soth I com as fast as I may Episcopus offyr up ?our rodde sere in goddys name why do ?e not as men ?ow pray. Joseph Now in Ã¾e wurchep of god of hevyn I offyr Ã¾is ?erde as lely whyte prayng Ã¾at lord of gracyous stewyn With hert with wytt with mayn with myght And as he made Ã¾e sterrys seven Ã¾is sympyl offrynge Ã¾at is so lyght to his wurchep he weldygh evyn Ffor to his wurchep Ã¾is ?erd is dyght lord god I Ã¾e pray to my herte Ã¾ou take good hede and no thynge to my synful dede Aftyr my wyl Ã¾ou qwyte my mede As plesyth to Ã¾i pay. I may not lyfte myn handys heye Lo Lo Lo What se ?e now. Episcopus A mercy mercy mercy lord we crye Ã¾e blyssyd of god we se Art thou. et clamant omnes Mercy mercy. A gracyous god in hevyn trone ryht wundyrful Ã¾i werkys be here may we se A merveyl one A ded stok beryth flourys ffre Joseph in hert with-outyn mone Ã¾ou mayst be blyth with game and gle A mayd to wedde Ã¾ou must gone be Ã¾is meracle I do wel se Mary is here name. Joseph What xuld I wedde god for-bede I am an old man so god me spede and with a wyff now to levyn in drede It wore neyther sport nere game. Episcopus A-?ens god joseph Ã¾ou mayst not stryve god wyl Ã¾at Ã¾ou a wyff haue Ã¾is fayr mayde xal be Ã¾i wyve she is buxum and whyte as laue. Joseph A shuld I haue here ?e lese my lyff Alas dere god xuld I now rave An old man may nevyr thryff With a ?onge wyff so god me saue nay nay sere lett bene xuld I now in age begynne to dote If I here chyde she wolde clowte my cote blere myn ey and pyke out a mote and Ã¾us oftyn tymes it is sene. Episcopus Joseph now as I Ã¾e saye God hath assygnyd here to Ã¾e Ã¾at god wol haue do sey Ã¾ou not nay oure lord god wyl Ã¾at it be so. Joseph A-?ens my God not do I may here wardeyn and kepere wyl I evyr be But fayr maydon I Ã¾e pray Kepe Ã¾e clene as I xal me I am a man of age therfore sere busshop I wyl Ã¾at ?e wete Ã¾at in bedde we xul nevyr mete Ffor i-wys mayden suete An Old man may not rage. Episcopus This holyest virgyn xalt Ã¾ou maryn now ?our rodde floreschyth fayrest Ã¾at man may se Ãe holy gost we se syttyht on a bow Et hic cantent. Benedicta sit beata trinitas. now ?elde we all preysyng to Ã¾e trenyte. Joseph wole ?e haue Ã¾is maydon to ?our wyff And here honour and kepe as ?e howe to do. Joseph nay sere so mote I thryff I haue ryght no nede Ã¾er-to. Episcopus Joseph it is goddys wyl it xuld be so sey aftyr me as it is skyl. Joseph Sere and to performe his wyl I bow Ã¾er-to Ffor all thynge owyght to ben at his wyl. Episcopus et idem joseph Sey Ã¾an after me? here I take Ã¾e Mary to wyff to hauyn to holdyn? as god his wyll with us wyl make and as longe as be-thwen us? lestyght oure lyff to loue ?ow as my selff? my trewth I ?ow take. nunc ad mariam sic dicens Episcopus Mary wole ?e haue Ã¾is man And hym to kepyn as ?our lyff. Maria In Ã¾e tenderest wyse fadyr as I kan and with all my wyttys ffyff. Episcopus Joseph with Ã¾is ryng now wedde Ã¾i wyff and be here hand now Ã¾ou here take. Joseph Sere with Ã¾is Rynge I wedde here Ryff and take here now here ffor my make. Episcopus Mary mayd with-outyn more stryff On to Ã¾i spowse Ã¾ou hast hym take. Maria In chastyte to ledyn my lyff I xal hym nevyr for-sake but evyr with hym a-byde And jentyll spowse as ?e An seyd lete me levyn as a clene mayd I xal be trewe be not dysmayd both terme tyme and tyde. Episcopus Here is Ã¾e holyest matremony Ã¾at evyr was in Ã¾is werd Ã¾e hy? names of oure lord we wole now syng hy we all wole Ã¾is solempn dede record devowtly Alma chorus domini nunc pangat nomina summi. Now goth hom all in godys name Where as ?our wonyng was be-fore Maydenys to lete here go alone it wore shame It wold hevy ?our hertys sore ?e xal blysse Ã¾e tyme Ã¾at sche was bore now loke ?e at hom here brynge. Maria To haue ?our blyssyng ffadyr I falle ?ow be-fore. Episcopus he blysse ?ow Ã¾at hath non hendyng In nomine patris et filij et spiritus sancti. Episcopus Joseph Ã¾i selph art old of Age And Ã¾i wyff of Age is ?onge and as we redyn in old sage many man is sclepyr of tonge Ãer fore Euyl langage for to swage Ã¾at ?our good fame may leste longe iij damysellys xul dwelle with ?ow in stage With Ã¾i wyff to be evyr more a-monge I xal these iij here take Susanne Ã¾e fyrst xal be Rebecca Ã¾e secunde xal go with the Sephore Ã¾e thrydde loke Ã¾at ?e thre Ã¾is maydon nevyr ?e for-sake. Susanne Sere I am redy Att ?our wyll with Ã¾is maydon for to wende. Rebecca ?our byddyng sere xall fful-ffyl and ffolwe Ã¾is maydon ffayr and hende. Sephor To ffolwe hyre it is good skyl And to ?our byddynge wole I bende. Joseph Now sere buschop hens go I wyl for now comyth on to my mende A matere Ã¾at nedful is. Episcopus Ffare wel joseph and mary clere I pray god kepe ?ow all in fere and sende ?ow grace in good manere to serve Ã¾e kynge of blysse. Maria Ffadyr and modyr ?e knowe Ã¾is cas how Ã¾at it now doth stonde with me with myn spowse I must forth passe and wott nevyr whan I xal ?ow se Therfore I pray ?ow here in Ã¾is plas of ?our blyssynge for charyte and I xal spede Ã¾e betyr and haue more gras In what place Ã¾at evyr I be On knes to ?ow I falle I pray ?ow fadyr and modyr dere to blysse ?our owyn dere dowtere and pray ffor me in all manere and I ffor ?ow all. Joachym Almyghty god he mote Ã¾e blysse and my blyssynge Ã¾ou haue Also In all godnesse god Ã¾e wysse on londe or on watyr wher evyr Ã¾ou go. Anna Now god Ã¾e kepe from every mysse and saue Ã¾e sownd in welth from wo I pray Ã¾e dowtyr Ã¾ou onys me kys or Ã¾at Ã¾i modyr parte Ã¾e fro I pray to god Ã¾e saue I pray Ã¾e mary my swete chylde be lowe and buxhum meke and mylde Sad and sobyr and no thyng wylde and goddys blyssyng Ã¾ou haue. Joachym Ffor wel joseph and god ?ow spede wher so ?e be in halle or boure. Joseph Almyghty god ?our weys lede and saue ?ow sownd from all doloure. Anna Goddys grace on ?ow sprede Ffare wel mary my swete fflowre Fare weyl joseph and god ?ow rede Ffare weyl my chylde and my tresowre Ffare wel my dowtere ?yng. Maria Ffare wel fadyr and modyr dere at ?ow I take my leve ryght here god Ã¾at sytt in hevyn so clere haue ?ow in his kepyng. Joseph Wyff it is ful necessary Ã¾is ?e knowe Ã¾at I And my kyn-rede go hom be-fore for in soth we haue non hous of oure owe Ã¾er fore I xal gon ordeyn and thanne come ?ow fore We Ar not ryche of werdly thynge and ?et of oure sustenauns we xal not mys therfore A-bydyth here stylle to ?our plesynge to worchep ?our god is all ?our blysse. he Ã¾at is and evyr xal be Of hefne and helle Ryche kynge in erth hath chosyn poverte and all Ryches and welthis refusynge. Maria Goth husbond in oure lordys blyssynge he mote ?ow spede in all ?our nede and I xal here a-byde ?our A-?en comynge and on my sawtere book I xal rede Now blyssyd be oure lord ffor this of hefne and erthe and all Ã¾at beryth lyff I am most bound to ?ow lord i-wys ffor now I am bothe mayde and wyff. Now lord god dyspose me to prayour Ã¾at I may sey Ã¾e holy psalmes of dauyth wheche book is clepyd Ã¾e sawtere Ã¾at I may preyse the my god Ã¾er with Of Ã¾e vertuys Ã¾er of Ã¾is is Ã¾e pygth It makyht sowles fayr Ã¾at doth it say Angelys be steryd to help us Ã¾er with it lytenyth therkeness and puttyth develys Away. Ã¾e song of psalmus is goddys dete synne is put A-wey Ã¾er by It lernyth A man vertuysful to be It feryth mannys herte gostly who Ã¾at it vsyth custommably it claryfieth Ã¾e herte and charyte makyth cowthe he may not faylen of goddys mercy Ã¾at hath Ã¾e preysenge of god evyr in his mowthe. O holy psalmys O holy book Swetter to say than Any ony Ã¾ou lernyst hem love lord Ã¾at on Ã¾e look and makyst hem desyre thyngys celestly With these halwyd psalmys lord I pray the specyaly ffor all Ã¾e creatures qwyke and dede Ã¾at Ã¾ou wylt shewe to hem Ã¾i mercy and to me specyaly Ã¾at do it rede. I haue seyd sum of my sawtere and here I am at Ã¾is holy psalme in dede Benedixisti domine terram tuam In this holy labore lord me spede. Joseph Mary wyff and mayd most gracyous displese ?ow not I pray ?ow so long I haue be I haue hyryd for us a lytyl praty hous and Ã¾er-in ryght hesely levyn wole we Come forth mary and folwe me to Nazareth now wele we go And all Ã¾e maydonys bothe ffayr and fre with my wyff comyth forth also Now lystenyth well wyff what I tell Ã¾e I must gon owth hens fer Ã¾e fro I wyll go laboryn in fer countre with trewth to maynteyn oure housholde so Ã¾is ix monthis Ã¾ou seyst me nowth Kepe Ã¾e clene my jentyl spowse and all Ã¾in maydenys in Ã¾in howse Ã¾at evyl langage I here not rowse Ffor hese love Ã¾at all hath wrought. Maria I pray to god he spede ?our way and in sowle helth he mote ?ow kepe and sende ?ow helth bothe nyth and day he shylde and saue ?ow from al shenschepe Now lord of grace to Ã¾e I pray with morny mood on kne I krepe me saue from synne from tene and tray with hert I mourne with eye I wepe lord god of pete Whan I sytt in my conclaue all myn hert on Ã¾e I haue Gracyous god my mayden-hed saue Euyr clene in chastyte.
